revisionDesc.change: Proofreading Corrections: Heyde dates and Silent Proof
Clean encoding (editor, date, remove "_large") and add standard annotations on unannotated files (Jeff W, Martha [Mattie], George W, Lou Haslam)
Encode regularization of contractions, days of week, and frequently misspelled words

body.p:
i got your letter to day tuesday Tuesday with the money all safe am Obliged to you for it
i thought perhaps the snow storm would prevent my getting it to day but it come and mrsMrs. Oconer sO'Connor's it is a beautifull beautiful letter very friendly and very kind if she ever comes to new york New York i hope she will come and see me and stay awhile give my love to them all) we sent hanna s Hanna's box last thursday Thursday we sent it by hildreth s hildreth's express i told him to pay the freight and bring the receipt or check to me and i would pay him he came that evening but brought no receipt but said he had it to the office that they generally put them there so i paid him 1–65 cts for the freight but have never heard whether they ever
received it or not i wrote a letter to han thursday Thursday and kept it open till the express came thinking he would have a check so i could put it in the letter i sent the letter on friday Friday morning with a list of the articles in the box if i dont don't hear something about it to morrow i will write to heydeHeyde i shall be very sorry if she dont don't get them georgeGeorge says he thinks its it's all right) we sent 2 dresses and lot of muslin and flannel skirts and can of peaches and new years cake and lot of french French candy and 2 dollars in mony mony and cotton and sewing silk and linings for the dresses it would be too bad if she dont don't get them Edd says the darnd darned bugger will send em off to his sister that han wont won't get them eddEddy is very indegnant indignant indeed
i felt anxious to get them and went out one of those slushey slushy days dident didn't get my feet wet but got them very damp and cold and i got such a very bad cold and pain in my face i was real sick two or three days i couldentcouldn't sleep for the pain in my face saturday Saturday night in the evening it got easey easy so i slept quite good and sunday Sunday morning i felt better and i was very glad i did for Davis came in the forenoon and staid stayed till toward evening he staid stayed to dinner we used the new knives and castor georgeGeorge helpt helped me get dinner so we got along nicely davisDavis told georgeGeorge all about the works and a draying of the ingine engine house he had with him) georgeGeorge was much interested he is very clever he talks some of going back by the way of washingtonWashington he thinks of starting next mondayMonday
i have had a letter from matt she seems to be gaining quite much i think by what she says) Jeffy is very busy she says but every thing goes on so nicely that he is very jubilant)

Walter dear you spoke of sending me an atlantic if you havent havn't sent it when you get this letter you need not georgeGeorge bought one on saturday Saturday night he thinks your peicepiece is very fine very indeed i like it too better every time i read it) davisDavis will get one to take home)

the house is progressing quite well the weather has been so good they have the second story beams laid but this bad weather is some against them but they have worked to day i beleivebelieve) georges George's men commenced to lay pipe but had to stop to day) good bie i hope you will keep well walterWalter dear i got quite down while i was sick it dont don't take much to get mama discouraged in these days
